conclusion: The angle between the trajectory of the ball and the vertical direction is 45 degrees.
Use trigonometry to find the relationship between the forces acting on the ball.
The electric force F is equal to the gravitational force G in magnitude, forming a right-angled triangle with the trajectory as the hypotenuse.
Using tan(45°) = F / G, since tan(45°) = 1, we have F = G.
The electric force F can be expressed as qE, where E is the electric field strength.
The electric field strength E can be calculated using the formula E = U / d.
Substituting F = qE into F = G, we get qE = G.
Solving for q, we have q = G / E.
Substituting E = U / d into the equation, we get q = Gd / U.
The charge amount of the small ball is q = Gd / U.
